info.author: Fabrice Laporte
info.description:
![logo.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/KEry5r/images/660077346-logo.png)

# keyriban - dynamic real-time view of pressed keys

> ** / kēribăn /** :  
>   1. *[kiriban -- キリ番]* a milestone; an interesting number displayed on a web counter  
>   2. *[key⋅[riban](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/riban)]* a terminal program displaying keylogging statistics such as last pressed key, key rate and key counts.  

## Description

Bring key *overlay* to your asciicast by running keyriban in a dedicated tmux panel!

## Install

First install a keylogger, I recommend (read: it has been tested with) : 
- [logkeys](https://github.com/kernc/logkeys) for Linux 
- [keylogger](https://github.com/Kraymer/keylogger) for Mac OS X

keyriban is written for [Python 2.7](ttps://www.python.org/downloads/) and
is tested on Linux and Mac OS X.

Install with [pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/) via
`pip install keyriban` command.

## Usage

keyriban [--calibrate] KEYLOG_FILE

  KEYLOG_FILE           external keylogger output file

Options:

  --c, calibrate        help keyriban detect your logfile format
info.name: keyriban
